messageBody:
yme0987654321,

You can use assumptions in 4.5 and afterward to ignore entire classes:

public class BigLongTest {
@BeforeClass public static void isRunningAppropriate() {
assumeTrue(runningBigLongTests());
}

@Test...
}

Does that work?

David Saff

On Mon, Feb 16, 2009 at 10:54 PM, yme0987654321 <yme0987654321@...>wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I've tried looking around the group but I haven't seen an answer to
> this. I'm trying to set up a group of tests that runs only under
> certain circumstances. Because they are database tests, they have
> expensive setup and teardown procedures (via DBUnit), so they are
> segregated to run separately. The way to get that done seems to be via
> a separate runner, so I hacked up a class that looks like this:
> (Inspiration from here:
> http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/CustomJunit4RunnerJUnit4_4 but that
> example no longer applies to the 4.5 API):
>
> public class SlowTestRunner extends Runner {
>
> private Runner runner;
> private Class<?> klass;
>
> public SlowTestRunner(Class<?> klass, RunnerBuilder builder)
> throws Throwable {
> this.klass = klass;
> if (Boolean.getBoolean("RunSlowTests")) {
> runner = getAppropriateRunner(builder);
> } else {
> runner = new IgnoredClassRunner(klass);
> }
> }
>
> private Runner getAppropriateRunner(RunnerBuilder builder) {
> List<RunnerBuilder> builders = Arrays.asList(
> new IgnoredBuilder(),
> new AnnotatedBuilder(builder),
> new SuiteMethodBuilder(),
> new JUnit3Builder(),
> new JUnit4Builder());
>
> for (RunnerBuilder each : builders) {
> Runner runner = each.safeRunnerForClass(klass);
> if (runner != null && runner.getClass() != this.getClass())
> return runner;
> }
> //this is actually never going to happen, at least in the
> current implementation because the JUnit4Builder is the Builder of
> last resort.
> return new ErrorReportingRunner(klass, new
> InitializationError("Unable to find suitable runner to delegate for "
> + klass.getName()));
> }
>
> public Description getDescription() {
> return runner.getDescription();
> }
>
> public void run(RunNotifier notifier) {
> runner.run(notifier);
> }
> }
>
> The method getAppropriateRunner is basically a copy/paste from
> AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder. I had to copy paste because the
> protected method forced a return of an AnnotatedBuilder, instead of
> just a RunnerBuilder, so overriding wasn't working well. Note the case
> here is that I'm not sure if the class is a JUnit3 or 4 class, and I
> want to support both with one runner.
>
> At first I tried to just do a runnerForClass on builder passed to the
> constructor, but that causes an infinite loop, because the class has
> the RunWith annotation on it that references the very same Runner.
>
> Am I correct that the API isn't naturally supporting what I am trying
> to do, or is there another way to accomplish this?
>
